citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
A research protocol (AP-201299-0627) was reviewed that did not include a complete description of the anesthetic agents
used in the study animals. The agents used for anesthesia were listed in a supplemental document attached to the
protocol, but the routes of administration and dosages were not indicated. A complete description of procedures requiring
anesthesia is necessary in a proposal to conduct animal activities to ensure that the IACUC has all of the information
required to approve these animal activities, that all personnel understand what the approved procedures are, and that
discomfort and pain are appropriately limited for the animals. The facility must ensure that protocols contain a complete
description of procedures designed to assure that discomfort and pain to animals will be limited, including provision for the
use of analgesic, anesthetic and tranquilizing drugs where indicated and appropriate. Correct by January 16, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
